body:
Does this ring any bells with anyone?  Otherwise I'll dig in.

I'm trying a clean install in a just-cloned repository.

I'm installing gcc-5.4.0.  It fails early on with:

```
[...]
==> Installing bzip2
==> Fetching http://www.bzip.org/1.0.6/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Staging archive: /rss/spack-20161204/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-y37ln2uyixh4hdxovx5hz2klnkdfapxl/bzip2-1.0.6.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /rss/spack-20161204/var/spack/stage/bzip2-1.0.6-y37ln2uyixh4hdxovx5hz2klnkdfapxl
==> patch() function failed for bzip2
==> Error: TypeError: argument of type 'ArchSpec' is not iterable
```
title: bzip2 fails to install, "argument of type 'ArchSpec' is not iterable"
